borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p><span style="font-size: 11pt;">The proposed development (including the two storey rear/side extension, loft conversion and rear dormer), by reason of bulk, mass, scale, siting and design, would result in a disproportionately large dwellinghouse with a top-heavy roofscape, by increasing the height of the ridge of the roof of the existing side extension, resulting in the loss of the appearance of a subordinate extension and further detracting from the original roof design, character of the dwelling and causing the&nbsp;loss of balance and symmetry within the terrace row. The development also involves the construction of a hip-to-gable loft conversion, changing the shape of the original roof to an angular, boxy form, at odds with the </span><span style="font-size: 14.6667px;">prevalent</span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">&nbsp;roof form in the area. As such, the proposed development is detrimental to the character of the area and is contrary to:</span></p><ul><li><span style="font-size:11pt">Paragraphs 131 and 135 of the National Planning Policy Framework&nbsp;&nbsp;(NPPF) (DLUHC, December 2023);</span></li><li><span style="font-size:11pt">Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021);</span></li><li><span style="font-size:11pt">Policy CP3 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010);</span></li><li><span style="font-size:11pt">Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011);</span></li><li><span style="font-size:11pt">Paragraph 5.3.3 and 5.6.2 of the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);</span></li><li><span style="font-size: 11pt;">Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenhamâ€™s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021).</span></li></ul>
description:
Construction of a first floor rear extension and a first floor side infill extension and the construction of a hip-to-gable roof extension to accommodate a rear dormer extension including three roof lights to the front, one roof light to the rear and a Juliette balcony to facilitate the conversion of roof space into
habitable accommodation
